Comments_List: I learned basic graphics concepts. How to apply linear algebra to use OpenGL and draw nice curves. How to use 3D geometry to make cool things in a ray-traced scene. Plenty of theoretically interesting concepts like how light refracts and how eyes work, and also practical considerations like how to make collision detection fast. Useful if you want to make a computer program with good/fast graphics, including games or just animations.
Learned basic and advanced concepts in Computer Graphics. Developed skills in javascript.

Material is good, and I appreciate how the slides are posted for each class. Assignments are cool.
It needs to be moved to a later time, so students who can't wake up at 9 can still attend. Exams need to be shorter so they can be reasonably finished in time.

The problem sets were pretty difficult and it was hard to get help (since there was no TA for the class). Most of them were pretty interesting.
Class teaching style could get a little dull sometimes since it was just powerpoint slides.
Good class. Would recommend. Fun topics, well taught. Too early in the morning.
If you're curious what technologies underly Unity3D, Blender, Maya, etc., this class if for you. You do a lot of cool stuff using WebGL.
